channel.title: Jeremy Warner
channel.description: I am an EECS Ph.D. student at UC Berkeley, and am advised by Björn Hartmann. My research focuses on systems-building human computer interaction work - check out some of my projects. Before this, I attended the University of Rochester, where I worked with Philip Guo.

item.title: using the oakland chip
item.description: My project group for Interactive Device Design used Oakland’s CHIP as the brains of our final project: mewsician, your musical companion. Mewsician’s goal was to provide more intrinsic motivation to...

item.description: Sometimes I record audio with my iphone. The format that it saves the recording in is m4a, which is a wrapper for AAC/MP4, and there is no way to easily...

item.title: rubys any and all in js
item.description: I wrote a simple implementation of Ruby’s Enumerable#all? and Enumerable#any? in Javascript, using Array.prototype.reduce. They are a nice way to check if a condition holds for all or any elements...
